item.title: 5 Things to Know About Robert Roberson’s Stayed Execution in Texas
item.description: The state wanted to put him to death by lethal injection. Then a court intervened.

item.title: No Showers, Black Mold and Clogged Toilets: America’s Jails Are Disgusting
item.description: Understaffing, outdated facilities and poor management have led to filthy conditions in jails in St. Louis, Cleveland and Hinds County, Mississippi.

item.title: Can a Biometric Bracelet Stop People From Dying Behind Bars?
item.description: Jails across the country are trying a high-tech solution to keep prisoners safe. Will it work?

item.title: Pressure Mounts on Cuyahoga Sheriff for Independent Probe of Tasha Grant’s Restraint Death
item.description: Community advocates and surviving family members also want the sheriff to step aside in two other death investigations involving deputies.

item.title: Did the ‘Psychopath Test’ Help Send an Innocent Man to His Execution?
item.description: The case against Robert Roberson, whose execution is scheduled for Oct. 16, is the latest to raise questions about a controversial diagnosis.
